title: Purdy authors 'close to a perfect game' with 5 TDs
content: With 44-year-old Colts quarterback Philip Rivers and his comeback occupying most of the headlines entering Monday's game, it was Brock Purdy who stole the show, throwing five touchdown passes in leading San Francisco to a 48-27 win at Lucas Oil Stadium.

title: Metcalf suspended two games for fan altercation
content: The NFL has suspended Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf for two games without pay due to his altercation with a fan at Detroit's Ford Field on Sunday.

title: Rivers turns back clock but can't will Colts to win
content: Newly unretired Philip Rivers turned in an impressive individual performance Monday night that saw him throw for 277 yards and two touchdowns. But it wasn't enough to deliver the Colts a win against the 49ers as Indianapolis saw its playoff hopes fade.

title: Green leaves court after heated exchange with Kerr
content: Warriors coach Steve Kerr and forward Draymond Green got into a heated argument during a third-quarter timeout Monday night, causing Green to leave the bench and miss the final 20 minutes of a 120-97 win over the Magic.

title: Self: Family wants Peterson near 100% for return
content: Kansas coach Bill Self said Monday night that Darryn Peterson's family does not want the projected No. 1 pick to return from injury until he is "as close to 100 percent as possible."

title: Pacers hope NBA looks at play that injured Jackson
content: Indiana Pacers coach Rick Carlisle wants the NBA to look at a play in the first quarter where he says Boston Celtics center Neemias Queta elbowed Isaiah Jackson twice, forcing the forward out of his team's 103-95 loss as he was evaluated for a concussion.

title: Chiefs agree to deal to move to Kansas in 2031
content: The Kansas City Chiefs announced Monday that they have entered into an agreement with the state of Kansas to play their games there beginning in 2031.

title: Hornets rookie Knueppel fastest to make 100 3s
content: Hornets rookie Kon Knueppel became the fastest player to make 100 3s in the NBA, reaching the mark in 12 fewer games than the next-fastest player.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus each team's rookie of the year
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 17. We also looked at the best rookies from all 32 teams.

title: MLB aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: NBA All-Value Team: 15 players who are outperforming their deals
content: Which two-way and minimum-level players are providing the biggest boosts to their teams? Bobby Marks unveils his roster.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke slides after loss vs. Texas Tech
content: Arizona retains the top spot. Duke falls three positions. USC and Iowa replace St. John's and Auburn.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The seventh in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: Chelsea are using Strasbourg as a "farm team" -- is this the new blueprint for top clubs?
content: Strasbourg now exists as a training ground for Chelsea prospects, akin to baseball's farm system. Is this the future of European soccer?

title: Overreactions: Are Villa in the title race? Can Wolves avoid history?
content: Just before we hit the crowded festive fixtures, we have plenty to overreact to in the Premier League.

title: Logan Lednicky caps dream with volleyball title at Texas A&M
content: The fourth-generation Aggie helped Texas A&M win its first volleyball title in a most improbable fashion.

title: Buzz: Omarion Hampton trending up and more notes from Week 16
content: Omarion Hampton is getting more work, Barkley is getting it done on the ground, and more takeaways from Week 16.

title: Free agent pickups: Load up on Jaguars
content: All of the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 17 and the fantasy football championships.

title: 2025 MMA awards: Joshua Van's breakout year earns him multiple honors
content: With MMA on a end-of-year break, an ESPN panel voted on their best of 2025, including best event, fighters, submission and knockout.

title: Week 17 odds: Jaguars big favorites at Colts, 49ers favored over Bears
content: Week 17 features critical matchups with the NFL playoffs approaching. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every game.

title: Betting lines for each College Football Playoff quarterfinal matchup, bowl games
content: Lines for Miami-Ohio State, Oregon-Texas Tech, Alabama-Indiana, Ole Miss-Georgia and remaining bowl games.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 16, featuring George Kittle
content: Before the NFL's Saturday slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The transfer window is set to open across Europe in January, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Pickups: Raynaud, Landale among several quality center options
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Greta Thunberg Arrested At 'Prisoners For Palestine' Protest In London
content: London police on Tuesday arrested Swedish activist Greta Thunberg at a demonstration in support of pro-Palestinian hunger strikers, Palestinian activist groups said.

title: Husband, Mother Kill 2 Children, Then Die By Suicide Over Custody Battle
content: As the deadline to return his children to his estranged wife approached, a man and his mother allegedly killed the two children at their home in Kerala. According to the police, the mother and son subsequently died by suicide.

title: Man Accused In Rs 13,000-Crore Drug Smuggling Case Extradited From UAE
content: A Delhi Police team was dispatched to the UAE and successfully brought Ritik Bajaj back to India on Tuesday. He landed in New Delhi today to face legal proceedings.

title: Trump Claims He Used 25% Tariff Threat To Make Macron Relent On Drug Prices
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday said he convinced French President Emmanuel Macron to accept his demands on drug prices as he pushes for lower costs for Americans.

title: 8,000 Files, Surveillance Videos Released In Latest Epstein Document Dump
content: At least 8,000 new documents related to the case of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were available on Tuesday on the US Department of Justice's site (DOJ).

title: Kerala Cracks Down On Quick Commerce Apps Over Big "Delivery Dash"
content: In an effort to reclaim Kerala's roads from the "delivery dash", the Motor Vehicles department has issued a stern ultimatum to major online platforms.

title: US Teen Dies After Falling From Building Featured In Stranger Things
content: A 19-year-old girl died after falling from the roof of a five-storey abandoned building in US, which was used as a filming location for Netflix's Stranger Things.

title: US-Based Kashmiri Separatist Nabi Fai's Properties Attached By Probe Agency NIA
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has taken a significant step against anti-India activities by securing a court order to attach properties belonging to US-based Kashmiri separatist Syed Ghulam Nabi Fai.

title: Unnao Rape Case: Expelled BJP Leader Kuldeep Sengar's Jail Term Suspended
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday suspended the jail term of expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar, who is serving life imprisonment in the Unnao rape case.

title: Five Labourers From UP Die of Suffocation At Haryana Resort
content: In a tragic incident at a private resort in Haryana's Kurukshetra, five labourers from Uttar Pradesh died due to suffocation.

title: In Call Of Duty Founder's Ferrari Accident, A Paul Walker Porsche Crash Reminder
content: Vince Zampella, the acclaimed co-creator of the "Call of Duty" video game series, has died in a car crash in California. He was 55. His death was confirmed by Electronic Arts, which owns Respawn Entertainment, a game studio he co-founded.

title: Younger Brother Or Frankenstein's Monster? Delhi-Dhaka 54 Years On
content: In October 2019, Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was speaking at a gathering of the India-Bangladesh business forum in New Delhi when she referred to India's decision to ban the export of onions after a delayed monsoon hit supplies.

title: "Anyone Who Attacks My Wife Can Eat...": JD Vance Over Anti-Semitic Remarks
content: Far-right commentator Nick Fuentes has repeatedly used racist slurs to target the second lady, Usha Vance, an American born to two Indian immigrants.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 'Rahul Unapproachable', Struggling Congress Bets On Priyanka Gandhi
content: Irrespective of whether the sharp spotlight on PGV is organic or manufactured, public opinion about giving PGV a larger campaign role is undeniable and only growing

title: Bhupesh Baghel's Son Got Rs 250 Crore In Liquor Scam: Chargesheet
content: Chaitanya, son of former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, received Rs 200 crore to Rs 250 crore as his share from an alleged liquor scam in the state, the Anti-Corruption Bureau/Economic Offence Wing (ACB/EOW) claimed in its chargesheet.

title: Delhi Court Orders Charges Against Karti Chidambaram In Chinese Visa Scam Case
content: Special Judge (CBI) Dig Vinay Singh, who was hearing the case against Karti Chidambaram and seven others, ordered the framing of charges against seven accused and discharged one named Chetan Shrivastava in the case.

title: Russian Man Kills Ex-Wife At Dubai Hotel Over Suspicion She Worked As Escort
content: The victim, 25-year-old Anastasia, was found in her hotel room with at least 15 stab wounds to her neck, torso, and limbs.

title: "Unavoidable Circumstances": Bangladesh Suspends Visa Services At Agartala Mission
content: Several organisations and political parties have been protesting outside the mission against the lynching of a Hindu man in Bangladesh.

title: India Announces Rs 4,000 Crore Reconstruction Package To Rebuild Sri Lanka
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted that India's relief and assistance mission under Operation Sagar Bandhu commenced on the very day Cyclone Ditwah made landfall in Sri Lanka.

title: Akhlaq lynching case: Court rejects UP govt plea to withdraw charges against accused
content: A court in Gautam Buddha Nagar has dismissed the Uttar Pradesh government's plea to withdraw prosecution in the Akhlaq lynching case. The judge's decision was lauded by Akhlaq's lawyer, who stated that justice has been served to the family. The next hearing is scheduled for January 6th.

title: 'Demands from everywhere': Vadra on Cong leader's Priyanka for PM pitch
content: Robert Vadra backed Congress MP Imran Masood’s push for Priyanka Gandhi as a potential PM face, saying there are demands from everywhere for her, and even for his own entry into politics, while stressing focus on real issues. Priyanka had flagged rising attacks on minorities in Bangladesh, where a Hindu youth’s lynching led to arrests and strong condemnation.

title: Virat Kohli just 1 run away from history; check his Vijay Hazare numbers
content: Virat Kohli is set to grace the Vijay Hazare Trophy after a 15-year hiatus, featuring for Delhi under Rishabh Pant. This move, aligning with BCCI directives, offers crucial preparation for the upcoming New Zealand ODI series.  Kohli, on the cusp of 16,000 List A runs, brings formidable recent ODI form to the domestic stage.

title: Instagram Vs TikTok: Mosseri critiques rival’s strategy, outlines TV app plans
content: Instagram's Adam Mosseri sees TikTok excelling at surfacing new content but potentially faltering by becoming a "super app" for Western users. He highlighted Instagram's business and monetization strengths, noting US pressure on TikTok provided a competitive advantage. Mosseri also discussed Instagram's TV app experiments and future plans for user feed control and augmented reality integration.

title: 'Prisoners for Palestine’: Greta Thunberg arrested by UK police during protest; detained under terrorism act
content: Greta Thunberg was reportedly detained by British police in London on Tuesday during a pro-Palestinian demonstration. The climate activist was allegedly arrested under the Terrorism Act while participating in a protest outside Aspen Insurance's offices. Police have not yet confirmed the details of the incident.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to more predictable automation. Executives admit a decline in AI model trust, citing instances where agents missed instructions or lost focus. This move follows significant staff reductions attributed to AI deployment, as the company navigates the gap between AI hype and practical business needs.

title: Two dates, three traps: How to fix your NPS, PAN and ITR before Dec 31
content: December brings crucial financial deadlines. Ensure your NPS Scheme A is switched by the 25th to avoid unwanted changes. The 31st marks the final chance for belated or revised tax returns, crucial for carrying forward losses. Also, verify Aadhaar-PAN compliance for specific PAN holders to prevent inoperability. These actions prevent future financial headaches.

title: More Indians are applying for jobs in 2025, says data: Is the job market keeping pace?
content: India’s job market in 2025 reflected movement rather than momentum. Apna.co’s India at Work 2025 report shows job applications rising 29 per cent to over 9 crore, driven by women and freshers. Hiring expanded beyond metros, led by SMBs, while competition intensified amid steady, not dramatic, job creation.

title: PCB chief Naqvi to lodge formal complaint against India U19 boys
content: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) plans to complain to the ICC over Indian Under-19 players’ conduct during the Under-19 Asia Cup 2025 final. PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi and mentor Sarfaraz Ahmed accused Indian players of provocation and acting against cricket’s spirit. Pakistan won the final by 191 runs, claiming their second U19 Asia Cup title.

title: FCC announces new ban list that American drone pilots have been dreading for months
content: The US has banned foreign-made drones, impacting Chinese giants like DJI, due to national security concerns. This move, while not affecting existing drones, has angered half a million US pilots who rely heavily on these devices for various critical tasks. American manufacturers see this as a significant opportunity to innovate and lead.

title: 'Is this AI?': JD Vance's photos training with Navy SEALs has netizens shocked
content: Vice President JD Vance recently underwent rigorous training with U.S. Navy SEALs in California. Photos show him participating in demanding exercises like carrying logs and climbing obstacle courses. The 41-year-old veteran completed a 90-minute workout, leaving him feeling exhausted. The images have circulated online, drawing praise for his strength and endurance from the public. Read here to know more!

title: Electoral might: BJP shows Rs 6,900cr bank balance, BSP an astounding 580cr; Cong Rs 53cr
content: Post-Delhi assembly election disclosures to the Election Commission show BJP holding over Rs 6,900 crore in bank balances, far ahead of rival parties. Congress has about Rs 53 crore, while the BSP holds Rs 580 crore despite limited presence. Congress had reported Rs 517 crore in large donations in 2024–25.

title: OTD: How Boycott overtook Sobers; became Test cricket's top run-scorer
content: On this day in 1981, England's Geoffrey Boycott shattered Garry Sobers' long-standing Test run-scoring record in Delhi. Needing 82, Boycott achieved his 22nd century, reaching 8,037 runs. This milestone marked a significant moment before his subsequent, abrupt retirement from the game.

title: Exclusive: Gill to play in Vijay Hazare Trophy; Ranji Trophy appearance on the cards too
content: Shubman Gill will represent Punjab in two Vijay Hazare Trophy fixtures on January 3 and 6 before joining the ODI squad against New Zealand. He has also expressed his desire to participate in the remaining Ranji Trophy matches for Punjab. This domestic stint precedes his involvement in the IPL, having been axed from the T20I World Cup squad.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s emotional apology after Chiefs loss
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Assault over 'tu': Doctor suspended for hitting patient in Shimla hospital
content: A doctor at Shimla's IGMC was suspended after a video showed him brutally assaulting a patient who objected to being addressed disrespectfully. The patient alleged the doctor began punching him after he asked for politeness. An inquiry is underway, with authorities promising exemplary action against the involved medical staff.

title: Watch: Moment 'Call Of Duty' creator’s Ferrari crashes in California; bursts in flame
content: Call of Duty co-creator Vince Zampella tragically died in a high-speed Ferrari crash on Sunday. Disturbing video footage of the final moments before the fatal accident has surfaced online, sparking widespread shock and concern. Zampella, a visionary game developer, co-founded Infinity Ward and Respawn Entertainment, leaving an indelible mark on the gaming industry.

title: Moon impact alert: scientists track asteroid 2024 YR4 and its potential effects
content: Astronomers are closely watching asteroid 2024 YR4. This space rock may hit the Moon in December 2032. The impact could be visible from Earth. It could also send debris towards Earth. This poses a risk to satellites and future human missions. The James Webb Space Telescope will provide more data. Scientists are monitoring the skies for safety.

title: World record: Five wickets in an over! Indonesia bowler scripts T20I history
content: History was etched in T20 Internationals as Indonesian pacer Gede Priandana achieved an unprecedented feat, claiming five wickets in a single over during the match against Cambodia. This remarkable performance, which included a hat-trick, saw Cambodia collapse and secured a significant victory for Indonesia. Priandana's achievement surpasses previous records held by renowned bowlers.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city?
content: Gold and silver prices reached unprecedented highs on Tuesday, driven by investor demand for safe-haven assets amidst geopolitical tensions and anticipated US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. Both domestic and international markets saw significant surges, with gold futures on MCX and Comex hitting record levels.

title: Tata Motors to launch 5 new electric cars, set up 1 million charging points by FY30
content: Tata Motors is accelerating its electric vehicle ambitions, planning five new EV launches by FY2030, starting with the Sierra EV next year. The company will invest up to Rs 18,000 crore to bolster its EV lineup and charging infrastructure, aiming for one million charging points nationwide. This aggressive expansion follows their milestone of selling 250,000 electric cars.

title: Indian doctors are leaving the UK! Money troubles or policy pressures? Here’s the real reason
content: Indian doctors and nurses are increasingly leaving the UK's NHS due to rising costs, tighter immigration rules, and reduced job security. Financial strain, better global opportunities, and restrictive government policies are pushing many to seek careers elsewhere, with visa numbers for Indian healthcare workers seeing significant drops. This trend impacts the NHS workforce.

title: Gold price jump record high of $4,467; US- Venezuela oil tensions fuel the rally
content: Gold prices hit a new record high Tuesday, driven by escalating geopolitical tensions as the US seized Venezuelan oil tankers. Silver also neared historic peaks, extending a strong rally in precious metals.  Expectations of lower US interest rates and a weaker dollar further fueled this surge, making gold an attractive safe haven for investors.

title: Vijay Hazare: Virat Kohli’s Chinnaswamy comeback delayed; matches move to CoE
content: Virat Kohli's highly anticipated return to the M Chinnaswamy Stadium for the Vijay Hazare Trophy has been postponed. Bengaluru police denied permission due to inadequate facilities, citing safety concerns. The matches, including Delhi vs. Andhra and Delhi vs. Gujarat, will now be held behind closed doors at the KSCA Centre of Excellence.

title: 'Sent a wrong message': CPM MP John Brittas targets Rahul, Priyanka; takes 'chai pe charcha' dig
content: A political rift has emerged within the INDIA bloc as CPI(M) MP John Brittas criticised Rahul Gandhi's absence from Parliament during the Winter Session. Brittas also expressed disapproval of Priyanka Gandhi's participation in a tea meeting with Prime Minister Modi, deeming it a "wrong message" after the passage of key legislation.

title: Ashes: Mitchell Starc creates history; shatters Waqar Younis’ 30-year-old Test record
content: Mitchell Starc delivered a match-winning all-round performance to help Australia clinch the Ashes, securing an unassailable 3-0 series lead. Starc's 3 wickets in the second innings and a crucial half-century capped a historic year, making him the only bowler to take 50 Test wickets in 2025 with an exceptional strike-rate of 28.7, surpassing Waqar Younis's long-standing record.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office: Film inches towards Rs 580 cr, beats 'Kantara'
content: Released on December 5, 'Dhurandhar' has dominated the box office, becoming the biggest second-weekend grosser of all time. The film achieved a rare feat by surpassing its first-week collection in its second week and has now entered the Rs 900 crore club globally within 18 days, making it the highest grosser of 2025.

title: 'I hope I get justice': Flyer beaten by Air India Express pilot suffers nasal fracture; FIR filed
content: A passenger, Ankit Dewan, suffered a displaced nasal bone fracture after an alleged assault by an off-duty Air India Express pilot at Delhi airport. The incident reportedly began when Dewan objected to staff cutting the security queue. The pilot has been removed from duties pending an investigation, and police have registered a case.

title: Hindu man killed in B'desh: Major showdown in Delhi; protesters break barricades
content: Vishwa Hindu Parishad protested at the Bangladesh high commission in Delhi over the mob lynching of a Hindu worker. The incident has escalated tensions, leading to the Indian envoy being summoned by Bangladesh's foreign ministry. Both nations have temporarily halted consular and visa services amidst the growing diplomatic friction.

title: WC snub: Caught on the wrong foot - Did Gill pay the price for India’s T20 misadventures?
content: Shubman Gill faces a stark career shift, axed from the T20 World Cup squad despite recent captaincy roles. Questions arise about his inclusion in a strong lineup, with experts suggesting his T20 explosiveness was overestimated.  Gill's recent form and injuries impacted his selection, leaving him to focus on other formats.

title: India closer to $450m BrahMos pacts with Vietnam, Indonesia
content: India is nearing deals to export BrahMos supersonic cruise missiles to Vietnam and Indonesia. Russia has given its nod for these sales. These agreements, worth over Rs 4,000 crore, will make Vietnam and Indonesia the latest ASEAN nations to acquire the missiles. India is also looking to export other defence systems to friendly countries.

title: Deadline nears: How to link your PAN with Aadhaar before December 31
content: PAN-Aadhaar linking deadline: Link your PAN with Aadhaar by December 31, 2025, or face consequences. Unlinked PANs become inoperative from January 1, 2026, impacting tax refunds and leading to higher TDS.

title: Investment nightmare: Ex-Punjab Police IG shoots self after Rs 8cr cyber fraud; suicide note found
content: Former Punjab Police IG Amar Singh Chahal is in critical condition after a self-inflicted gunshot, reportedly due to an Rs 8.1 crore online investment scam. A handwritten note detailed how he was defrauded by a group named 'F-777 DBS Wealth Equity Research Group'. This incident follows a similar case involving another IPS officer in the region.

title: 'I have a bulletproof car': Rashid Khan reveals Kabul life, stuns Kevin Pietersen – Watch
content: Afghanistan's cricket sensation Rashid Khan revealed the stark reality of his fame, sharing that he requires a bulletproof car for safety in Kabul and cannot walk freely on the streets.  This sobering truth highlights the constant danger he navigates, a stark contrast to the typical life of a global sporting icon.

title: Who is Aaron Rodgers’ wife Brittani? Inside the Steelers QB’s marriage mystery
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: ‘Russians losing equipment’: Ukrainian drone strikes soldier on horseback – video
content: Ukrainian forces released drone footage showing Russian soldiers advancing on horseback, suggesting significant equipment shortages. The 92nd Separate Assault Brigade reported that Russian forces are resorting to unconventional methods due to rapid equipment losses during assaults. The video depicts drones neutralizing riders, with Ukrainian officials confirming the soldiers were killed.

title: Vanessa Bryant’s net worth: Exploring legacy and responsibility after Kobe's death
content: Vanessa Bryant now handles the vast financial legacy of her late husband and basketball legend, Kobe Bryant. Her net worth is estimated at $600 million as of 2025. She manages investments, endorsements, including Body Armor, and manages real estate. Vanessa also leads Granity Studios and Mamba Cita clothing and uses the money she earns from it to support young athletes. She continues brand partnerships and the Mamba & Mamba Cita Sports Foundation.

title: Cyclone Ditwah aftermath: India announces $450mn aid for Sri Lanka
content: India has pledged a comprehensive USD 450 million assistance package to Sri Lanka for reconstruction efforts following Cyclone Ditwah. This aid, comprising concessional credit and grants, builds on India's initial humanitarian response and aims to support critical infrastructure and recovery needs, reinforcing New Delhi's commitment to its neighbor's stability.

title: Sleep loss, stress, obesity emerging as key risks for breast cancer: ICMR study
content: A new ICMR study reveals disrupted sleep, rising stress, and central obesity are driving India's breast cancer surge, projected to add 50,000 cases annually. Lifestyle shifts, reproductive delays, and hormonal factors are reshaping disease patterns, differing from Western trends. Researchers emphasize prevention and early screening.

title: 'We should be prepared to fight': CDS warns of evolving threats; cites terror, land disputes
content: India must prepare for both swift, high-intensity conflicts to counter terrorism and prolonged wars stemming from territorial disputes, Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated. He emphasized the need for multi-domain operations, citing Operation Sindoor as an example of simultaneous warfare across all domains.

title: Remedial teaching to improve SSLC results in districts of Kalyana Karnataka region
content: The State government has earmarked ₹3.44 crore for the project, to be borne by Kalyana Karnataka Regional Development Board (KKRDB).

title: Supplyco Christmas-New Year fair gets under way in Kollam
content: Fair offers 20 kg of rice per person at ₹25 a kg. Special discount available for more than 280 products, with branded daily essentials sold at 5% to 50% discount

title: Living in the melody of Mohammed Rafi
content: Tirur native Saifullah Cholakkal’s love affair with the legendary singer’s voice began when he listened to Tumne Mujhe Dekha as a five-year-old. Over the years, he has collected nearly 5,000 songs sung by Rafi, spanning vinyl records, cassettes, CDs, and DVDs

title: Uttar Pradesh Court rejects government plea to withdraw charges against Akhlaq murder accused
content: Additional District Judge Saurabh Dwivedi rejected the Public Prosecutor’s plea under Section 321 of CrPC, which sought to drop charges against the 14 accused

title: Citizens need not be passive observers, ‘Jan Bhagidari’ cornerstone of people-centric security: President
content: President Murmu said the social media has transformed the world of information and communication, and it has the potential for both creation and destruction

title: Pradhan urges Centre to add Odisha's 108 SEBC communities in central OBC list
content: "I would like to draw your kind attention to a matter of great significance concerning the parity between the State and central lists of Other Backward Classes (OBC) in Odisha," says The Union Education Minister

title: CBI coordinates return of accused drug smuggler from UAE
content: More than 150 wanted criminals have been brought back in the past few years through the CBI’s coordination via Interpol channels

title: Stalin slams Palaniswami for not raising voice against Centre’s ‘dilution of MGNREGS’
content: “You once claimed to have exerted pressure on your masters not to remove Mahatma Gandhi’s name from the scheme. But what has happened? The Centre does not seem to accord you even the slightest importance,” he said, directing his words at Mr. Palaniswami

title: ‘Feel more scared as an Indian than as a Hindu,’ says West Bengal student in Bangladesh
content: The situation in Bangladesh has changed considerably from what it was in mid-2024, with mobs now replacing protesting citizens, the student said

title: Labour shortage during peak farm season to be addressed by new law: Shivraj Chouhan
content: The VB-G RAM G Act, which replaces the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA), was passed in Parliament last week

title: Mumbai smog: Bombay High Court slams civic bodies for neglecting construction workers’ safety
content: The court observed that the civic bodies have failed to act on ground; directs urgent steps to shield labourers from toxic air at construction sites

title: L-G Saxena writes to Arvind Kejriwal, slams him for pollution in New Delhi
content: The Delhi Lieutenant Governor said AAP continues to “indulge in petty politics and spreading lies over the critical issues concerning the people of Delhi”

title: Lecturer arrested for stealing valuables from wedding venues in Bengaluru
content: One such incident was reported on November 25 at Dwarakanath Kalyana Mantapa in Basavanagudi, where she allegedly stole gold ornaments

title: Concern over xenophobia in Kerala: NGO
content: Centre for Migration and Inclusive Development says that at least one mob lynching has been reported in Kerala since 2023

title: Stopping someone from feeding strays in non-designated areas is not illegal: Bombay HC
content: A Bench of Justices quashed a criminal case registered against a resident for allegedly stopping a woman and her friends from feeding stray dogs at the gates of their housing society

title: Unnao rape case: Delhi High Court suspends jail term of Kuldeep Sengar, grants bail
content: A Bench of Justices Subramonium Prasad and Harish Vaidyanathan Shankar released Mr. Sengar on bail while directing him to furnish a personal bond of ₹15 lakh with three sureties of the like amount

title: Biryani outing to Hoskote at night ends with four engineering students getting abducted and robbed while returning to Bengaluru
content: According to the police, the students had gone from Bengaluru to Hoskote to have biryani and were intercepted by some men while they were returning around 5.30 a.m.

title: India's maternal mortality rate declined significantly because of rise in institutional deliveries: J.P. Nadda
content: Nadda was addressing a function after laying the foundation stone for a medical college in Dhar district on a PPP model

title: Advocates of Shivamogga write to CJI and HC Chief Justice opposing HC judge’s participation in programme to be presided over by former minister
content: Karnataka High Court judge Justice V. Shrishananda has been invited to give a lecture in a programme to be presided over by former minister K.S. Eshwarappa in Shivamogga on December 25

title: INSV Kaundinya to set off on voyage to Oman on December 29
content: The Indian Navy’s pioneering stitched sailing vessel, which revives India’s ancient shipbuilding and seafaring traditions, will undertake her maiden overseas voyage on December 29

title: Kerala CMO interfering in Sabarimala SIT probe through IPS officers, alleges Congress
content: Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan alleges that two IPS officers were assigned by Chief Minister’s Office to ‘exert intense pressure’ on SIT probing the gold loss case

title: Most common surnames deleted during SIR from Kolkata are ‘Das’ and ‘Singh’ reveals analysis
content: The surname analysis indicates that non-Bengali surnames have dominated the deletions during the first phase of SIR

title: BJP’s national working president Nitin Nabin leads roadshow in Patna
content: The roadshow began from Aranya Bhawan near the Patna airport and will culminate at Miller High School ground near the State BJP office

title: Piyush Goyal holds seat-sharing talks with Palaniswami, attacks DMK government
content: He says Tamil Nadu has suffered under the “corrupt DMK regime” and it is important for the people of the State to get a good government focused on providing women, youth, farmers, fishermen, industrialists, and traders with a better future

title: PUC norm to stay even after GRAP-IV ends: Manjinder Singh Sirsa
content: The Delhi Environment Minister said “12 PUC [certificate issuing] centres were found to be doing irregularities. They have been suspended and they will be black listed”

title: Passenger beaten by off-duty Air India Express pilot suffers nasal fracture, seeks justice
content: "I am right now focusing on my health, and a CT scan today showed a displaced fracture of the left nasal bone. I hope I get justice in the matter," says passenger

title: PMK leader Anbumani urges immediate relief for rain-hit Cauvery delta farmers
content: In a statement, Dr. Anbumani alleged that even after completing the assessment of crop damage, the DMK government had not disbursed the compensation

title: T.N. CM Stalin writes to External Affairs Minister seeking permanent steps to prevent fishermen arrests
content: In his letter, Mr. Stalin drew Mr. Jaishankar’s attention to the arrest of 12 fishermen from Rameswaram and the seizure of their mechanised boat by the Sri Lankan Navy on Tuesday

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS alliance to be announced on Dec. 24, says Sanjay Raut
content: The crucial Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections will be held on January 15, 2026 and counting of votes will be on January 16, 2026

title: Delhi HC dismisses plea of Hizbul chief's sons against framing of charges in terror funding case
content: “Case pertains to transfer of funds through hawala channels by Pakistan-based terrorists to Jammu and Kashmir, in a criminal conspiracy hatched with some operatives in India, to fuel and fund secessionist and terrorist activities in Jammu and Kashmir,” says National Investigation Agency

title: Startup communities launched in four villages in Cuddalore district
content: Inaugurating the startup communities, Collector Sibi Adhithya Senthil Kumar said the scheme was aimed at encouraging sustainable economic development in villages

title: Special NIA court orders attachment of property of U.S.-based Kashmiri lobbyist
content: The Court directed the Budgam Senior Superintendent of Police to provide necessary support, if required, to the Collector while attaching the property

title: BJP leader hacked to death by unidentified assailants in Chhattisgarh’s Korba
content: “Three masked men attacked Akshay Garg, a construction contractor and a member of the Katghora Janpad panchayat, with sharp-edged weapons,” Korba SP Siddharth Tiwari said

title: Roadside surgery: Heroic response by three young doctors saves accident victim in Kerala, earns praise
content: Quick thinking and medical expertise of Manoop B., Thomas Peter and Dideeya Thomas saved the life of a critically injured accident victim as the trio performed a life-saving procedure on the road at night using razor blade and straws

title: Karnataka Minister promises early execution of PM MITRA Textile Park in Kalaburagi
content: Minister Shivanand Patil said that tenders had been issued for KPTCL work, road development, construction of a water barrage and other essential infrastructure, and assured that the remaining work would be taken up and completed at the earliest

title: Chaos at Bangladesh High Commission as VHP, Bajrang Dal protesters clash with police
content: Police struggled to keep the demonstrators at bay as they tried to climb over barricades and denounce the Bangladesh government

title: Permission denied for cricket match at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru
content: On December 23, City Police Commissioner Seemant Kumar Singh announced the government’s decision, along with an explanation for the same

title: IndiGo already permitted to operate 5 leased B737 planes from Turkey till March '26: DGCA
content: According to DGCA, the lease of five Boeing 737 planes taken from Turkey's Corendon Airlines ends on March 31, 2026.

title: Congress attacks Modi Govt. on Aravalli issue, asks why 'hell-bent' on redefining mountain range
content: “Why are the recommendations of a professional organisation like the Forest Survey of India being deliberately ignored and set aside?" asked Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Itanagar Police arrests two from J&K for espionage activities in Arunachal
content: According to the police officer, the accused were allegedly involved in collecting sensitive information from different parts of Arunachal Pradesh and sharing it with handlers based in Pakistan

title: Amaravati to anchor Knowledge Economy as India’s Quantum Valley: Naidu
content: “will evolve into major electronics and aerospace centres, creating a distributed but interconnected innovation ecosystem across the State,” says N. Chandrababu Naidu

title: London-Hyderabad British Airways flight gets bomb threat, lands safely
content: Standard safety protocols include isolation of the aircraft, screening of baggage and passengers, keeping fire engines ready and pressing sniffer dogs into service, among others, sources added

title: Four arrested and 20 cars seized for cheating the owners
content: “The case came to light following a complaint by Pulla Srinivasa Reddy of Vijayawada, who reported that his car was misused after being pledged,” says Palnadu Superintendent of Police

title: Delhi court orders framing of charges against Congress MP Karti Chidambaram in Chinese visa scam case
content: In an order dated December 23, the court ordered the framing of charges against the seven accused for the alleged offence of criminal conspiracy

title: Man murders colleague, dumps body in water tank in Palghar; held
content: The accused, Asaram Rakesh, was nabbed within hours of the incident that occurred at an industrial estate in the Vasai area on Monday, an official said.

title: Messi event fiasco: Calcutta High Court refuses to interfere in SIT probe
content: Rejecting a prayer for interim relief on the matter, the court said that at this stage, it is not inclined to interfere and stay the investigation

title: Violence in Assam’s Karbi Anglong: No fresh violence reported, prohibitory orders remain
content: Authorities maintain a strict prohibitory order following violent protests demanding the eviction of encroachers, with peace efforts underway amid heightened security and ongoing negotiations

title: Bird flu outbreak confirmed in Kerala’s Alappuzha and Kottayam districts
content: In blow to poultry farmers ahead of Christmas-New Year season, authorities confirm presence of highly pathogenic avian influenza virus in one ward each of eight panchayats in Alappuzha and in four villages in Kottayam

title: Rahul Gandhi is anti-India leader: BJP MP slams Lok Sabha LoP over his remarks in Germany
content: BJP MP Shobha Karandlaje questioned the "aim" of the Lok Sabha leader for "speaking against the nation" and said that he "still behaves like a child."

title: India announces $450 million relief package for Sri Lanka’s post-cyclone recovery
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar said India “stands firmly with Sri Lanka” at this difficult time

title: How Bengaluru celebrated Christmas in the ‘80s and ‘90s, a look at bygone days
content: We gather a few of Bengaluru’s nostalgic Christmas stories, from Nilgiris cake exhibitions to the towering Christmas tree on Brigade Road

title: NIA DG Sadanand Date repatriated to parent cadre Maharashtra
content: NIA DG Sadanand Vasant Date, a 1990-batch officer, hailed as a 26/11 hero, is the frontrunner to be the Maharashtra DGP as incumbent Rashmi Shukla's tenure is coming to an end on December 31.

title: Nomination process for Municipal Corporation elections begins in Maharashtra
content: The political parties in both ruling Mahayuti and Opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) camp are yet to officially announce the seat-sharing arrangement

title: Move away from reels and shorts and take up reading, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister expressed concern over the growing addiction to social media reels and shorts that last only a few seconds, saying such habits prevented the youth from concentrating on anything

title: Delhiites wake up to hazardous air, AQI crosses 400 at 27 stations; several others slip to ‘severe plus’ range
content: Delhi's minimum temperature dropped to 8.8 degrees Celsius, which is 1.3 degrees above normal, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said

title: On the right to a healthy environment
content: Amid rising air pollution, legal interpretations linking environmental rights to the right to life and explicit constitutional provisions to enforce environmental protections, emphasising the state’s responsibility, is the need of the hour

title: BJP proposing elimination of Indian Constitution: Rahul Gandhi in Berlin
content: We will deal with it, and we will create a method, a system of opposition resistance that will succeed. But, we're not fighting the BJP. You have to understand that we're fighting their capture of the Indian institutional structure, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Haridwar hotel cancel Christmas event after protest by Hindu groups
content: The hotel had advertised about its Christmas events on social media on which the Hindu groups objected to

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS to announce alliance in two days
content: After the Maharashtra Assembly elections, where Shiv Sena (UBT) performed poorly, winning only 20 seats out of 288 seats, while his cousin Raj Thackeray’s party MNS won zero seats, both decided to explore a new union

title: AgustaWestland: Court reserves order on Christian Michel’s plea seeking release in CBI case
content: The release was sought on the grounds that he had already undergone the maximum period of sentence of seven years for the charges against him

title: Bangladesh High Commission stops visa services citing ‘security situation’
content: Over the weekend, there were sharp exchanges between India and Bangladesh after a group of men came to the main gate of the Bangladesh mission in Delhi and shouted slogans

title: SC constituencies in Tamil Nadu see lower reduction in electorate size due to Special Intensive Revision
content: Around 32,080 voters have been deleted in every SC constituency, while the State’s average is 41,615, according to data gathered from draft rolls

title: Telangana govt. announces one-time 90% interest waiver on GHMC property tax arrears
content: Decision taken after examining proposal submitted by GHMC Commissioner, seeking relief for taxpayers with long-pending dues

title: Will not let W.B. become Bangladesh, says BJP leader and actor Mithun Chakraborty
content: Ever since violence erupted in Bangladesh, the West Bengal BJP leadership has been trying to draw a parallel between the situation in Bangladesh and West Bengal

title: As tension eases, police allow devotees to climb the hillock at Thirupparankundram
content: However, police personnel have been posted at the hilltop to prevent devotees from approaching the deepathoon

title: Congress core committee yet to reach consensus on mayoral candidate in Kochi Corporation
content: The core committee comprises of UDF chairman Dominic Presentation, District Congress Committee president Mohammed Shiyas, and senior leader N. Venugopal

title: Two tanks within Kochi Corporation limits need urgent intervention, says KWA
content: The assessment was done in the wake of the recent incident at Thammanam, where a 1.35-crore-litre water tank burst, leading to water supply disruption and causing significant damage to nearby properties

title: MLB offseason grades: Another Met vet moves on as A's deal for McNeil
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: 'He just took over': How Mark Fletcher became the engine powering Miami's run
content: Shannon Dawson's game plan was to throw the kitchen sink at Texas A&M . he would run every twist on every play he could imagine until something broke . the score was tied at 3 and both offenses had traded blows in a battle of attrition .

title: Wetzel: Is this the last straw for NCAA enforcement?
content: Jeremy Pruitt coached the Vols from 2018 to '20 . he was fired after the school uncovered recruiting violations . in 2023, the NCAA's committee on infractions concluded the program committed 18 Level I violations - mostly related to paying prospects and their families .

title: 🤔 Ranking every CFB coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: What has gone wrong for four teams trying to make the playoffs?
content: the Lions lost 1-0 to the colts on tuesday night . it's the final week of the season, as we reset our content for the playoffs . we'll be back next Tuesday with my All-Rookie team (ooh!)

title: QB Brock Purdy and RB Christian McCaffrey help lead 49ers past Colts
content: the 49ers have a direct line to the NFC's top seed if they win their next two games . they will wrap up the division and home-field advantage throughout the playoffs . if the Niners can get the top seed, they won't need to play Super Bowl LX .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Wazzu QB Zevi Eckhaus has 3-TD Potato Bowl
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . the best performances from the bowl season will be announced on tuesday .

title: LeBron vs. Dillon Brooks: 'Social media junkie' to 'Help the bear' and everything between
content: the los Angeles lakers and Phoenix Suns have split two matchups this season . the two have had their fair share of battles on the court, but all comes down to competition . leBron James and Dillon Brooks will meet again on tuesday in Phoenix .

title: 'Dadgummit': 49ers troll Philip Rivers, Colts after victory
content: the 49ers beat the Indianapolis Colts 48-27 on "Monday Night Football" Purdy is the first 49ers quarterback with five passing touchdowns during a game . Colt signal-caller Philip Rivers had 277 passing yards and two touchdowns .

title: Quarterfinal first look: Every team's key player, big question, more
content: the canes beat Texas A&M thanks to an interception in the end zone in the final seconds of the game, and they will play Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl . the cotton bowls will be played on Jan. 1 and will be held on Dec. 31 .
